values:
Don't why I didn't think of doing this earlier.

5 months, $7.5k, London.

In other news, I love Elliott my BBBold.

XOXO

So today I'm staying in to nurse my sprained ankle.
 
I'm mighty pissed about it coz my boss made me go into the office yesterday to settle some stuff before she flew off for her 1.5 week vacay. I had to do all that unnecessary walking so imagine my horror and anger when I came back home and after dinner, I removed the cold compress to see it all purple. It was only a slight shade of red the day after but now its PURPLE and veiny and I'M SO ANGRY. *ROAR*

In other happier news, I traded in my Samsung Omnia for the Blackberry Bold last Monday for a sweet deal of only $188. And I even got reimbursed $25 for my trade-in for my one-year old phone. I was literally BEAMING when I stepped out because prior to going to the mobile shop I calculated it to be $388. Fantastic 'miscalculation' on the part of M1 website/customer service staff? Whatever I'm keeping mum to myself on that one.

Also I made myself Almond Soya French Toast smoothered with Tahiti Vanilla Milk Jam and sprinkled with Cinnamon Sugar for breakfast this morn. I took photos with my Bold but it turned out fuzzy and pixelated. While I need to figure out the camera, breakfast has since been gobbled 40mins before and I have nothing to show for. *ahahaha*

Gonna try my hand at Braised Bacon Cabbage Jamie-style and Steamed Tofu with Chinese Sausage & Fried Garlic later. Better luck on this one!

Xoxo
Because when you mix naivety and truth, it's always kinda heartbreaking.

That's the little plot of farming land that's downstairs of my place. It's a community garden for the residents and 2/3 rows are reserved for the kindergarteners who school at the kindergarten downstairs.
Cute eh? :)

I realised sunny Saturdays are the best days for me to be productive around the house. Always more up to cooking and cleaning. So today I did the laundry, the sheets, sweep & mop the floor and cooked lunch.

With Jamie's Cookbook and a little adaptation based on the current ingredients stocked in my fridge: Chicken wrapped with Bacon and Pommes Noisettes on the side. I haven't had those potatoes in a good ten years so yummy they are- dunno why I never bought them more often. Threw in the last of my chicken cheese sausage too and finished off with ice-cold C.C. Lemon. Pity there was't any fresh vege for salad and the bacon got a little burnt coz I got distracted by the washing machine. *haha* 
 
Oh and a last foodnote: I never had to bash my chicken with the bottom of a pan before. Crazy Jamie Oliver. I heart him so. *lol*

Well, pish posh what absolute nonsense!!! Gone stark raving mad - keep the tradition alive that's what I say!

Oct 7, 2009
LONDON - NURSERY rhymes are losing ground in Britain's affections, according to a survey on Wednesday, with many parents finding them too old fashioned and of no educational value.

THE favourite top ten:
1. Twinkle Twinkle Little Star
2. Incey Wincey Spider
3. Round and Round the Garden
4. Baa Baa Black Sheep
5. The Grand Old Duke of York
6. If You're Happy and You Know It
7. Humpty Dumpty
8. This Little Piggy
9. Ring a Ring a Roses
10. I'm a Little Teapot -- REUTERS

But for those who still believe, the favourite has proved to be Twinkle Twinkle Little Star ahead of Incey Wincey Spider and Round and Round the Garden. Only a third of more than 2,500 parents surveyed use nursery rhymes regularly with their children, while almost a quarter admit they have never sung a rhyme with their child.

 

The poll, for National Bookstart Day on Friday, also found more than a fifth of young parents did not use nursery rhymes because they were not considered educational. The survey also revealed that:

- The younger generation no longer knows all the words to traditional rhymes: Over 74 per cent of 55-plus year-olds knew all the words to Little Miss Muffet, compared to only 58 per cent of 16-24 year olds.

- Men are far less confident about singing nursery rhymes: Only 52 per cent of men surveyed knew all the words to Twinkle Twinkle Little Star compared to 83 per cent of women

- 63 per cent of parents said they used nursery rhymes because they make children laugh, while 18 per cent use them instead of reading a bedtime story.

Shot through the heart, 
and you're to blame. 
You give love, 
a bad name.

I just adore this picture.
Such excitement and merriment. 
And what lovely cheery pops of colour!

But wait... peer closely again at the litte tutu skirts- ooh how very unusual and interesting colour for little flower girls!

A fine and fascinating mix. :)

Try it, coz it's Real Simple.

 I like the tic-tac-toe one (how cute!) and I found #10- using salt to clean up a cracked up egg particularly interesting. :)

Iggy is the lizard that resides in my current place of residence. I detest him very much and he has been terrorizing me the last 3 weeks or so. I've been asking around for help how to rid of him as I hate lizards as much as I hate roaches. Well I didn't get much help on ridding him, but my brother and Nev christened him with a 'pet name'- Iggy. SO anyway, I've asked 2 people who've come over the last week to chase him out but he's gone into hiding and when I found him on Friday night... 


He was in the storage unit with the rubbish chute, on the ledge of the inside doors positioned to climb out of the storage unit.
I got a shock and banged it shut right? Then the second time I opened it, he was still in that same posture, half hanging onto the ledge to climb out, arms outstretched.
I totally freaked, even though he lay motionless.
Anyway the next day I cooked pasta for lunch but ended up cooking too much so I asked Dad over to help with lunch and he also cleared Iggy out.
He was still in that same postion.
I THINK HE WAS GASSED TO DEATH coz I sprayed the unit with odourless insecticide every time I do my chores on weekends.
Totally unintentional I swear but what a way to die.
And that posture was a dead giveaway- HE WAS TRYING TO ESCAPE FROM NAZI GASSING.

Omg no pun intended.

Always, I have wondered who is the genius behind all those random limited-edition Google holiday logos. Like a fleeting little secret, full of meaning- you've only just seen a glimpse of it but by the next day it's gone.

I always find it such a delightful surprise whenever a new one appears on the global site. Most interesting, incredibly fun and always with a touch of whimsy. It's just one of those little things that are so deceptively simple yet it never fails to put a smile on my face.

More indepth info on each holiday/event logo can be found here. A recent one I particularly enjoyed was the Oct 1 for Children's Day that appeared on the Singapore site (too adorable)! I think Eileen will particularly like Sep 3rd's for Japan and my brother for Jul 23rd :) 

Thank you Dennis Hwang for bringing cheer and fun into Internet surfing!

Marie biscuits are my new kryptonite.

I keep putting my hand into the biscuit container every time I go to the pantry!!

Must be the slight hint of vanilla scent and milky aftertaste that does me in. *sigh*

... I hid the container back into the cupboard it belongs. Out of sight, out of mind! *LoL*

Stayed up late and slept at 330am only to be woken up at 630 by a crazy deluge of rain and thunder so loud and repetitive it rattled the whole house (and my bed!), it took me a while to fall back to sleep.

Finally rolled out of the bed at 1150 to cook-up a hearty brunch for myself: a large side of white and button mushrooms with garlic & sweet white onions,  1 pork chipolata and 2 eggs on a thick slice of buttered gourmet bread. And a cuppa coffee.

KICKASS.

Just a tad short of some greens. *hehehe* But I forgot to take pictures. So eager was I to dig in. :P

I will attempt to make fluffy flapjacks next week, must remember to oh tori sasshin!

I've been procrastinating this long overdue project to renovate my El-Jay account. Am pleased to present a spanking new layout and a fresh coat of paint! 


1) In these past few months, I've closed some chapters and opened new ones, strengthened and affirmed friendships, experienced great disappointments and love from my closest kin & friends. With all that, I've also overhauled Self, Life and Wardrobe. New look for me, new look for my journal! Mayhaps this is the chysalis of me and new things to come? 

2) One cannot refute that a change of scenery is always good. 

3) Reminds me that London's calling! 

Enjoy :)

Occasionally, I'd miss Pho99 and IHOP.

Like today.


*sigh*

I ADORE Taylor Swift.

I'm extremely jealous that's she's like an angel- so damned pretty and such a pretty voice to match. And then there's this CD of hers that I can listen to everyday and 10 times on repeat.  Songs of a 15-year old- disgusting, I know! But there's just something about them lyrics.

If only I can look and sing half as good as her. *meep*

What if Ikea ran the Airlines?

After flying round trip to California from Chicago recently and encountering all kinds of disgust, I wondered — what if Ikea ran the airlines? You’d have to assemble your seat yourself but it would cost less and you would be able to select from different kinds. The food would be quality, tasty and cost very little. The customer service would be top-notch. And the planes would all be clean.

And if you had a change of plans, you could sell your seat on Craigslist.

— findsomecommonground

Taken from NY Times article here.
I especially hate it when that I get ALL signals at particular moments and all the drama cross-paths. MASSIVE HEADACHE.

Didn't realise I haven't updated since January. That's pretty crazy... considering I actually come onto ElJay pretty much every other day to read
ONTD. *shakes head at Self in disgust*

 
Of course, a lot of stuff have been happening, too much, too draggy, too stressful and convoluted to even post.

Maybe just a runaway excuse but now that the dust has somewhat settled, the body & mind is more at peace, my 29th just round the corner and I'm enjoying a personal day off with great cooling weather (HELLO SMALL DRIZZLE & COOL WIND! I always love when you visit in the Summertime!), here are a few bitesized nuggets to summarize:


1) Love - My brother & Djudju had their Chinese customary and wedding dinner at end-Feb. Everything was great, the bride looked lovely in her dress, my brother dapper in his tux. All pictures are on Facebook.

2) Recreate - I felt that something could'ave happened between Him and I especially from the beginning of this year. It was always simmering for the last year. In the last few months, it sparked and flamed, instances of so close yet so far.

3) Fleeting - There were too many instances of getting too close to fire. Now that feeling's gone. He's stayed out of the hunting/dating field for almost 2 years but suddenly, he knew as I did, that anytime soon something might happen. So, when the next available prey came along, he jumped at it just so that he don't get in to another tangle with me.  As the old adage goes, a leopard never changes its spots.

4) Sadness - I couldn't stand living with my Mom. Turning point was before Euge's wedding. I stopped talking more than 5 sentences a day to her since Feb.

5) Weight - I've lost 16.8kg in 9 months.

6) Breakfree - Early June, I moved out of the house and am currently staying with my Aunt J.

7) New home - My life is waaaay less stressful (work aside), and I like staying here, next to the canal, taking walks, having good 'ol homecooked food, helping with housework and being taken care of. From my first days of being here, I get breakfast laid out for me on the table and in the first 3 days;  walked to the busstop with my Aunt . I remember my very first thought was- even my mom never did these for me before. I felt like I was in Kindergarten. Swear, it was the best feeling ever. :)
 
8) Change - I've become (more) of a girly girl. My hair is at its longest and am wearing more dresses (coz I dun wanna iron pants ever again!). I've changed all my ElJay userpics, I think they pretty much reflect how I am now. 

9) Meetups - Spending quite a bit of time on Facebook now than befre *bashful* Met some IRC friends that I've not met in 9 years. So we change, and then again not so much. But sharing the updates and laughter =  :)

10) Joy - Body & Mind are more at peace. Enjoying my canal walks in the mornings and on weekends. Simple yet yummy home cooked food.  Its almost becoming easy to find fun and joy in simple things.


Feels downright wonderful.

I have a dream, a song to sing
...
I believe in angels
Something good in everything I see
I believe in angels
When I know the time is right for me
I cross the stream- I have a dream
I Have a Dream- Connie Talbot

Happy New Year's Everyone and best wishes for 2009!!! *hugs & kisses all*

After her 3-week vacay in Singapore to partake in her Sister's wedding, celebrate Christmas 08 & 09 NY's, Melissa leaves for London tomorrow. *boohoo* :( I want to send her off tomorrow even though her flight is 10pm-ish and I have work the next day. This trip back for her wasn't a very joyous one and I just wanna be there for her, just as we've bounced off quite a number of talks on the banes of our lives- family & love-wise mostly.  

Cousin  on the other hand, will be arriving in 9 days for a 14-day visit to meet brother Euge's mrs and also to spend CNY's with the family. I haven't seen her in almost 6/7 years! *is le excited*

Sus will also be arrivin during the CNY period and we will partake in this wonderful thing called GORGING ON SINGAPOREAN FOOD- right Charmaine? However this time I get to drag my cousin along- afterall she did go into this 3-hour MSN conversation listing all the food she misses. 14 days is not enough and I'm so doomed.

Why so? Coz I've been trying to lose weight, first for Mel's Sis's wedding and also more primarily for my brother's wedding in Feb. I have accomplished 11kg in the last 2.5 months and is looking at (ideally) another 5 kg before the end of next month. With CNY and 2 people who miss SIngaporean food like *crazy*, I reiterate- I am DOOMED.

Meanwhile am still waiting for cousin  to advise on her return dates! Good golly gosh, with both cousins back that I havent seen in almost 10 years- IT'S GONNA BE ONE HAPPY CNY's! *runs around like a rabid dog*

In other news, I curse myself for not purchasing the Lady Gaga CD when I was out gallivanting with Nev on Saturday afternoon- when all we really doing was just really whiling time away between lunch and coffee. As always, just hanging out & catching up on his life just between us always makes me happy, coz he's free from distractions and speaks honestly without hiding/sacarsm that always sneaks in his conversations with external company.  More importantly, huge congrats (& sigh of relief for me) on his promotion at the turn of 1st Jan- it means his job is secure + all his hard work & efforts recognized (I've been so worried for his job security in ML since the bloody BOA buy-over) and at least it validates to me why we aren't together since one of his reasons was him wanting to make it big for himself, by himself. *is le proud*

Lady Gaga will be mine!!! *shakes fist at my folly for not purchasing it when it was under my nose and now having to search all over town for it. GAH!!!*

Now I'll just mainly go back to worrying over Mel's job security in GSachs, 'Rents divorce court-hearing + current flat house-payment + Euge's Wedding plans & proceedings w/o any family uproar,  losing my last 5kg... and owning that blasted Lady Gaga CD.

Sure, Life could be better, but ain't complaining much. I have a lot of other things to be thankful for, as mentioned above.   :)

Xoxo
T

Merry Christmas Everyone!

I've been stripped of my voice and stayed home sick for > 50 hours since the eve of Christmas Eve and I've come to realise a coupla things:

1) When I say I have a throat inflammation and I have no voice- WHY call me on the phone and to chat and ask how I am?!?!?! *I.just.don't.get.it*
2) As such, I conclude we've grown up to be a cynical and disbelieving lot.
3) SMSing can be surprisingly irritating and energy-sapping.
4) I got really ticked off at my Dad and ignored every single incoming phonecall- seriously do people even realise what they do sometimes is totally retarded, and I'm supposed to play along with you? *long-suffering sigh*
5) Surprisingly, I'm pretty happy to stay home and just sleep, eat porridge/fish soup, twaddle around my room picking up gifts at my fancy to wrap since I'm not in any hurry to meet anyone *lol*, read christmas cards, watch DVDs and read magazines despite missing out on all the Christmas parties and gift exchanges.
6) Though I must admit I am a twinge disappointed not to be able to partake in my Dad's Christmas feast of lamb chops & sausages, and join Melissa's family for mass on Christmas Eve, I'm also probably happy not to, because it means I don't have to make excuses to my mom why I'm not around. I realised I've- almost-come-to-hate my two favourite most holidays because of estrangement between my parents because I need to make excuses to either one why I'm celebrating with one or the other and on no account am I being preferential nor do I need to give either one of you guys any reason or excuse. *frustrated*
7) Chatting to my cousins online on Christmas Day makes me really warm & fuzzy happy, coz I guess in a way its an extension of our childhood get-togethers when we used to celebrate Christmas together as kids with yummy dinners, giggly carolling and fun-filled gift exchanges in fancy christmas clothes, happy laughter and heaps of torn gift-wrapping & ribbons.
8) In a completely oblique verbal bluster, I declare WBros a selfish bitch coz I just wasted 2 hours of my life searching for the last 3 installments of GG to watch online (while totally forgetting that Warner Bros has banned all file-sharing of their works, I read in a recent ONTD post).
9) With the cold breeze coming into my study room (comp says its 26degs out), it feels way colder and I could really do with a tall cuppa Starbucks lowfat less whip extra sprinkles toffee-nut latte. Sipping it while snuggling under covers and watching my 1 of 2 favourite Christmas movies Serendipity.
10) Love Actually is my other favourite movie, I watched it 3 nights ago and I fell asleep with a smile on my face.

I just laid eyes on the HP Mini 1000 Vivienne Tam edition notebook and I think it is a SEXY BEAST. I want it. *sigh* I already have a pink VAIO and no I can't really afford it, but yea sure I want it. It's pretty, it's red and sexy as hell, it even has friggin pink-painted flowers on it. OK EXACTLY WHAT IS THERE NOT TO SALIVATE AFTER? Oh yea- the price point. That's always the kicker. More bucks for brand name always. It is also times like these that I hate working in marketing AND retail. *moueeeeeeeeee*

Ok enough with this nonsense, I'm going to do #9, sans the Starbucks! *pads off to bed merrily*

And I'm still having the sniffles!!! *icky, leaky nose!*

I'm almost done with all my Christmas shopping, and tomorrow I MUST complete all my Christmas wrapping! *whee at Christmas wrappers, ribbons, miniature ornaments, stickers and tape!* And yes Maine, it was safe to say on Friday night that I wouldn't do up the wrapping today (Saturday)- as you and I both know it. *moue*

I also must write a list of names of Christmas cards to write- I am so late!!! (And I hope I don't skip it like last year due to tardiness :(  )

Watched Jim Carrey's YesMan yesterday with E and I received my first Christmas present- a coffee table book of graffiti artist Banksy's works. *SWEET!*

Today, I met up with Melissa at VivoCity for dinner after my haircut and she also passed me my Christmas present. Which I was confused- because we always exchange presents only on Christmas Eve midnight mass. So I asked "Errr why so early hur?!" She said coz I need to clear the house and disseminate all my presents early this year. Immediately I realised the cause of this- Bridezilla must be rampaging through!!! 

Yes Mel's sister will be getting married on Monday and it sounds like its going to be so freaking nutso. A quick run-through of the Queen M's drama antics: Grand Venue is at the Fullerton Hotel, 'special invitees'- 3 Mediacorp actresses: KN, IL and YL + his dad's Minister friends, entertainment: the MCs are a sissy stylist + makeup/wardrobe artist from Mediacorp, CLASS ACT: a 'cortillion-like' dance where Daddy will waltz with Queen M and then give her away to the husband and they will waltz together (WTF!!!), younger cousin to serenade to the couple, (MORE WTF!!!) Vienna Choir Boys to sing at their wedding (retracts MORE WTF!!! statement because the Boys are not available due to schedule clash), dinner: Chinese cuisine sit-down affair with individual plate servings (har??? I thought only Western cuisine dinners are individually served?! O_o)

I'm afraid my head might implode on Monday night, or I might be treated to #1 wedding dinner ever attended in my lifetime. She sounds like GG's Blair, and TRUST ME she bloody well IS! Mel on the other hand, insists that she will elope just so that she doesn't have to go through all these rubbish of a hassle. I laughed. A lot.

In other news, my Christmas wishlist this year mainly centred around books: Tales of Beetle the Bard, Jamie's Ministry of Food, The One Hundred, CIG to Tarot, Watching the English. Anyone? Please?? *sad puppy dog eyes*

My leaky nose is annoying me again. I will thus take my leave to blow my nose as daintily as possible, and catch the last two episodes of GG that I have missed.

*airkisses you*

Met Charmaine after my Brother's belated bdae lunch with Daddio & Dju for a shopping spree at VivoCity today.

We spent some 2.5 hours at the PageOne bookshop just walking on the outer circumference of the pretty, wonderful store. Spent nearly 1/2 an hour at the stationary, kids, humour and tarot cards section each. We had to even stash our purchase selections aside and dash out of the bookstore for a pee break. Crazy I know. *rolls eyes drolly at own self* I must admit after the 2.5hr browse+spree session, our final purchases amounted to a somewhat strange combination; such as Maine's The Penguin of Death, and amongst my gifts of The Ninja Handbook, What's Cookin'? Recipe Box and The Truth-Seeker's Tarot set for yours truly.

After dinner and inbetween buying Western Timothy Hay for Maine's pet bunny, picking up 2 free muffins from Gloria Jeans Cofffee for my $147 purchase with PageOne (having some sweeeet jt promo for a free muffin with every $50 spent) and some crazy/hilariousclothes try-ons and 'christmas gift selections for marilyn' at Forever21, here's a mother-of-all-gems that she said today:

C: "When I have my own place, I'm going to have four Christmas trees."
Me: "Unnnh- why? WHY FOUR?!"
C: "So that I can have one in every corner."
Me: .... *BWAHAHAHHAHHAA!!!*

I hung up the phone tonight
Something happened for the first time
Deep inside
It was a rush, what a rush
Cause the possibility
that you would ever feel the same way
About me
It's just too much, just too much

Why do I keep running from the truth
All I ever think about is you
You got me hypnotized, so mesmerized
And I just got to know

Do you ever think
When you're all alone
All that we can be
Where this thing can go
Am I crazy or falling in love
Is it real or just another crush
Do you catch a breath
When I look at you
Are you holding back
Like the way I do
Cause I'm tryin, tryin to walk away
But I know this crush ain't goin' away

Crush- David Archuleta; one of my favourite songs at the moment

Everything got thrown for a loop, starting Thursday.

That was when HDB sent a letter stating that the house will be repossessed by 15 Dec 08.

Sometimes I think my mother is crazy. I mean SERIOUSLY flat-out stupid and dumb-ass crazy. I have proof of her idiocy. Like when I questioned her if she's called her lawyer regarding the letter or if she went down to HDB to check but instead she asks me: "How will they lock up the house?", thats when I screamed at her on the phone: "WAT- WOULD YOU LIKE TO WAIT TILL THE 15th TO FIND OUT?!?!"

Damn her and that ridonkulous warped divorce plans she has. fux, Fux, FUX!!!

On Saturday I freaked out that I didn't have a place to stay in 4 working days, that all my belongings, clothes, laptop and even favourite furniture will get taken away from me. I almost needed a paperbag to breathe into. I tested my brother and sis-in-law. They've always said that they were all up to take me in- but when it comes to the crunch, will they? Probably unfair but I had to make them think it through seriously...

Met Charmaine, Regina and Corine for dinner and had Teochew Porridge. It was fun, it was hilarious, it was outrageous. Also it kept my mind off things. Oui, Fantastic Four!

To keep things short, I chatted with Daddy some on Sunday and update him of the rubbish my mom was sprouting and spewing- he then decided that he will transfer the house to my name 100%, and not the 50/50% as agreed in the divorce proceedings since she's obviously latching onto the idea of owning it 100% for leverage means, and to try her grabby hands on everything else my dad has- even though she has no money to pay for the house's monthly payment, thinks that renting out the entire house to stay will be a 'good' source of income (I blew up and shouted-  "AND RENTING OUT THE ENTIRE HOUSE WHILE RENTING A ROOM FOR OURSELVES ELSEWHERE SEEMS LIKE A SMART IDEA TO 'KEEP' THE HOUSE?!?!"), and, that is not even to say that there isn't anything to her 'name' to pay up the remaining $190k for the house!!!

Thankfully for the chat with Daddy to resolve the ridiculous issue and chatting the remaining of the night with N, as a sounding board and afterwhich to keep my mind off things. Put a smile on my face with a silly song before I went to bed he did, after that turmultous weekend.

*hearts all for the love*

I barely watched 30mins of the movie but this was a gem coz I agree with Angelica-


Angelica: Well, is it love, big love, or great love?
Pete: What do you mean?
Angelica: Well, love you get over in two months, big love you get over in two years, and great love, well great love... changes your life. So which one is it?

[Pete laughs and takes a big gulp out of his drink]

Angelica: Oh my god, it's great love.
Pete: ... Yeah, that just great.

Hmm so many things since the last update, where should I start? *taps fingertip to lip*

Maybe from my last update shall we?

Well Euge Favourite Brother of Mine unfortunately did not win the Xbox Xpert. In fact he lost out by just two votes. I was totally bummed out, but then again as N says it- perhaps it is our fault coz Nev & I couldn't make it due to colleague's parties (farewell for him, birthday for me) and also El (then again she couldn't show support since she didn't know about it coz she MIA for exam preparations *hehe*). In Nev's words: "KELONG!!!" and "whoever said that 1 vote dun count?!" , Mim's on the other hand said- that's like having sex for 6 hours but still not getting an orgasm. Succintly said dear friends, but my brother says it best: "All in good fun." in his update to me on the phone just minutes after the results were out. Ah yes... that's my Favourite Brother. *beams proudly*

I graduated from SIM University on 26 October 08 with my Bachelor of Arts in Communication Studies & English Language, and invited to my convocation was Daddio and Auntie LF who was back from Vancouver to look after Auntie J whilst she was in hospital. Pretty damn happy to finish my 3.5 year course, but now am kinda at a loss- deliberating between taking a Masters, learning French, Japanese or driving, picking up a new hobby and going back to the gym. It's kinda like shopping for something new to do :X or plan my steps to working overseas. Thisi is going to take a while. 



The US financial crisis kept me on my toes and I was really worried for Nev who works in ML and Mel in Goldman. Still am. :( Am crossing my fingers that Nev will be fine, especially since he just recently told us that BOA wants to merge both companies to operate as one starting Jan 09 and with so many of his colleagues quitting in the last few weeks and him recently handing in his work performance accessment, the next few weeks must be extremely stressful on top of the depression swamping the office since the takeover. Mel's dept in Goldman was due for a retrenchment exercise 2 weeks back, since she called me last week and sounded fine, I'm guessing she's cleared. 

On 7-9 Nov, I went to Bangkok for a short vacay with my colleague buddy Cindy and just S$435 worth of Thai baht to my name, I managed to shop and bring back the whole of Bangkok. 11 tops and dresses, 3 scarfs, 3 necklaces, 2 hairbands, 2 bags, 3 pussybow neckties ala Gossp Girl, 2 Blythe picture frames, cutesy notebooks & stationary gifts, puppy-printed tissues, and almost 1/4 luggage space of snacks as gifts- and somehow managed to squeeze 17kg of luggage in a span of 60 hours of shopping thereabouts with that measly budget- pretty darn proud of myself tbh. *ROARS*

Which brings me to the whole crazy Thailand anti-government protests. Prior to my Nov vacay, we've already postponed it once as my original flight was scheduled in Sep but protestors bombed the Government House on Sep 1st and took fighting to the streets. Right now reports of the insane Suvarnabhumi Airport takeover by the protestors_ well no words can express how relieved I am to be back before it happened and I am totally in awe of how huge this whole thing has gotten. Because despite my initial fears of safety, in my 3 days there, life and the Bangkok streets and malls were extremely normal. I also remember standing in the middle of the Airport before checking-in, almost gleefully dancing around at how spacious and modern it is in comparison to the old crappy one.

The Mumbai terrorist attacks also depresses me greatly. All the reports of the attacks, especially the 'unbiased' mass shooting at the train station and their 2 grandest hotels make me shudder. So does the death of the 1 Singaporean hostage- she looks so young, successful and pretty and geniunely seems like such a great person and only just celebrated her 1st yr wedding anniversary recently. Good grief, she was only to be there for a 2 day worktrip like WTF are the odds?! So damn depressing and unbelievable...

In more uplifting highlights, Brenda jiejie- my best pal during my three years in Singapore Polytechnic, came back to Singapore for a 3-week off from work to get married with her hubby Jeffrey; also based in Melbourne after graduating. Their wedding took place last Sunday at Hyatt Hotel and almost all our classmates turned up to congratulate the happy couple. :) *YAY Brenda!*



Also in other news, my 6-bus and 1 Harbourfront NEL train station wall mural advertising campaign will be up islandwide starting tomorrow for the next 3 months. After 4 months of ridiculous stress and tooth-pulling pain with both my HK Regional Office and Moove Media, I'm pretty darn excited about seeing my 7x2.5m large mural decorating the front of the HBF station faregates.

It's Dec 1st and Christmas is round the corner, while it is always exciting to see my 6 shops decorated so festively, sales in stores and my roadshow is beyond worrisome and I really don't want to think about 2009- yet I've already planned my entire marketing calender to Dec 2009. I fear the budget and target for the 2009 new fiscal year in April.

Mel will be back from London for 3 weeks from the 17th for her sister's wedding at The Fullerton on the 22nd of Dec. While of course I'm happy for her sis, am actually quite blah about attending. Am just glad Mel's back in town for quite a while and that I get to sit next to her at the dinner. *chuckles*

Cozzie yueni also just informed me that she will be back in Singapore for 2 weeks from the 14th to celebrate CNY- I haven't seen her in almost 5/6 years so naturally I am extremely happy and excited. Hopefully Auntie LF and Cozzie Nee will also come back during the same period- CNY will be a BLAST! I havent seen Nee in more than 12 years so *omgomgomg*.

Lastly, Obama winning the US elections was pretty smashin and the campaign leading up to the win was probably the most exciting and active in comparison to any other in my 28 years of existence. I hope (and feel) that he can do a good job to raise the spirits of the Americans and also rebuild their reputation and the damned economy.

All in all, a darned stressful last 4 months of 2008. Just remember: Chin up, chest out, cheer up!

Auntie J is still in hospital, Big Daddio told me yesterday night that she had to undergo urgent surgery again this morning because her brain is flooded and she needed a bypass from brain to stomach to pass out the fluids.  My heart sank when I heard that.  Auntie LF who was due to arrive yesterday midnight must have freaked when Daddio picked her up from the airport.

I tried to finish up with work quickly today beause I really wanted to visit Auntie J and also 'cause I was going on leave tomorrow- preplanned 2 months ago to hang out with Melissa before her departure on Sunday.  But even with being desk-bound from 3 onwards to accomplish the design of my blasted mailer, e-mailer & e-annoucement of my newly renovated boutique at Ngee Ann City, making phonecalls to Female & Her World magazine account managers on my ad colourproofs, copy-editing the 2nd draft from Harper's Bazaar on their shitty ad copy for our winning the HB Beauty Award Winner for Most Rejuvenating Mask and 2 memos - I still only managed to finish work at 8pm.  My back felt like it was breaking and it was too late to got to the hospital. So effing depressing.

I will sleep in tomorrow, wake up just in time to run down to Macs to eat Hotcakes which I have been craving since Saturday past, visit Auntie J in hospital and then meet Mel in the afternoon.

Will also be meeting-up with Mel's snooty sister 'cause she's also taken leave to be with Mel... primarily to do shopping & gown fittings for her wedding. Which could be interesting & fun... or not. :/

Out of sorts today.

Met Mel today who is back for the week. That, I'm happy about. We spent the day together, mostly of shopping and getting a dress for her sister's wedding in December at the St Regis SIngapore. Oh yes you heard me baybeh- the ST REGIS alright. O.o

Was going a little loopy and I thought all hope was lost until she showed me The Dress, Said dress is DIVINE- gorgeous and so goddess-like. Honestly and all that fuss about if she should enter before the room first or the bridesmaid then her sister because she was terrifed the dress she picked in the end would look like shit. With this dress she should definitely go first (but of course at the risk of her looking like the bride *lol*), but then again, its $600+ for a probably worn-one-time-only-dress *wolf whistles*

Which reminds me that I shoud get a dress for my own brother's wedding which is in Feb 29 & Mar 1. Umm Joelle yea I finally got the dates from Euge, will u be able to make it? But I think you mentioned your vacay is in early Feb? How about Michelle and th rest of your folks? Blasted Euge really should be getting the invites out to you guys soon to let u guys prepare- oooh that bugger boy.

Mostly my feeling out of sorts is coz Auntie J is in the hospital. She was warded on Friday due to a sudden blood clot in her brain which had to be immediately operated on at the risk of the blood vessel bursting and flooding the brain. Her op was from 9pm-2am but it went well, we went down yesterday afternoon where she was still in ICU but fast asleep. My eyes watered when I first saw her coz her hair on the right side was completely shaved off- I dunno why I wasn't really expecting that and it was pretty scary to be honest.

She's out of ICU today and now put in a neurosurgery special ward, she was asleep when I visited her at 8ish. I rang Euge and he told me he reached at 4 but she was also asleep. Told me he bought her "a Get Well Soon balloon *hehe*", I smiled and I said I saw. I'd probably call my dad to pick me up and visit her again immediately after work tomorrow so that I can try to catch her awake. *crosses fingers*

It's been a long day and I'm going to bed now. Goodnight and *hugs you tight*.

Today, I wore my Cloisonne Bangles for the first time today and it made me think of my cozzies  and . Their mom passed the trio of bangles to me from them on her last visit to Singapore.

Not sure what they are? Clicky for the clinky.

So very pretty! *glee*

A quick swing-by just to say hi.

I cooked myself aglio-style linguine with topped with Salmon & crispy Sakura Prawns for lunch today. *yum* :)

Going to cook dinner shortly with yakisoba and chicken/chive dumplings, with a side of clam miso soup. All fresh from the supermarket, Japanese section. *haha*

In other news, just downloaded Skype and chatted with Mike. I say the reception is so incredibly clear- a far cry from my last use of it.. a year ago?  I can hear him talk to me from the toilet.. 5 m away from his comp. wonderful isn't it?

*laughs*

Xoxo
T

Hi Guys, how's it going?

I think I saw you, Joelle for a spot, online earlier in the evenng. How's settling in and Beijing so far?? Do tell!

I met up with Els & N on Saturday. Never knew a Diavola and Vongole dinner could cook up such fire and sparks but boy was there antagonizing and hilarity involved.  We also laughed much reminiscing over ELs' "Let's take up synchronized swimming" comment to Mimi. That.. that is Solid Gold that will go down in history,my friend. And Yes I know you are perfectly serious- which really only makes it more hilarious. :P

Went to Comex on Sunday and with Charmaine's help, bought a Maxtor 320g HDD for $129- cheap as hell but NEVER WILL I GO TO COMEX IN MY LIFE AGAIN- EVER. I swear the whole of Suntec, Marina, City Hall area looks like what a prison camp would look like if it suddenly let out all its prisoners. FRIGGIN OVERRUN & AMOK.

In other more 'Oh-kill-me-now-news', I spent the whole the whole of today and yesterday engaged in meetings with my boss E, and tomorrow will be MORE meetings with my Ops and GM. So much for that meeting last month on the Marketing team not communicating. *PFFFHT!!!* 

Now we're meeting every other day I really dun even have time to do anything else- and YES I DO have mountains of urgent outstanding shit with additional promotions/activities/events every 2 weeks to the marketing calender from August 08 till Feb 09, so much so that all those silly meetings are making me lost at work. *is damn lost grumpasaurus in the office* *ROARS*

And what with hoping my upcoming vacation in Bangkok next week will wind me down some, IT DECLARES ITSELF IN A STATE OF EMERGENCY. *Dammit and I say the same for myself!!!* Why did it have to riot/strike/go into berserker mode as a nation, now? Seriously at this rate, *my heart will NOT go on*.

I rushed home after work at 8 today so that I can watch the season premiere of Gossip Girls Seas 2. And YESSSS I managed to catch it 26 hours the US telecast- I amaze myself sometimes. 

Withat great bimbotic accomplishment, I shall take my leave for bed now.

Xoxo,
T

Went to Malacca with Nev & Els last month from the 12-14th by 4hr coach during the peak Jun school holidays. Scorched by the hot sun, walked Jonker Street and quest for a congkak board & authentic peranakan food every day that we were there.

Here's a quick picture post of the places we went to sightsee (Christ Church Melaka, Ruins of the Chuch of St Paul's & boatride down the Malacca river), eat (durian & mango chendol with lots of Gula MELAKA, yummy laksa & chicken rice balls) and navigate our way around with maps and Nev's Blackberry.

Went to Shinchan @ Robertson Quay for dinner today. Fantastic ramen- thin, firm and absolutely the best I've ever eaten. And the soup and ramen tastes so similar like the one I ate in Fukuoka with Mimi by the roadside under the blooming cherry blossoms in April last year. Authentic and oh-so-yummy!



Euge cheers with his Apple Cider while Nev tucks into his Pork Bone Ramen (Light). Els could do with Udon though but I appreciate that she made the effort to stomach ramen for my dinner. *muaks Els*   *^_^*
 


We then adjourned to Canele Patisserie. Nev picked the patisserie (fabu choice!) & I picked Le Royale petit gateaux. It was specifically the ingredient Almond Success that made this cake a winner. (Only successful almonds need apply.) *hahaha* Mimi you're missed in the group pic!



With mah brother Euge & Dju mah sis-in-law. Nev, Le Royale ,*huge grins* & me.



And to end off the hilarious and totally enjoyable night, here's the super sweet Le Royale's face with his bulbous raspberry red nose. I cut him up with that configuration- innit the cutest? *claps hands with glee*

Xoxo
T

so bored. so moody. I need an outlet to spill my frustrations.

Left the new workplace back for the old. Realised that Beauty may be Beauty but Cosmetics don't interest me like shower gels & body lotions do. Blusher in tube, pan, cream or powder is just bloody blusher to me. Maybe it's just because I'm a sensorial person, but I'll never go back into cosmetics in my life ever again even though my secret dream job was to be a cosmetic counter girl. Most girls want to be an SIA girl, I just wanted to be a cosmetic counter girl- must be the perfectly made up face, the bright lights and the 300 different shades of pink that made it look oh so wonderful. 

Unsurprisingly I still love my old workplace and the things I do. Maybe I should never have left, but then again if I didn't I wouldn't know what it is like to leave my comfort zone or to be managerial- albeit only for a month.

Speaking of managers- I kind of got my boss of this said 'new' workplace kicked out coz she is lousy boss and I thought she was stupid and inefficient. I honestly don't know if she quit or she got fired. I heard she tendered on the same day as I did. I said a lot of honest things that I didn't think she understood but when your marcomm team of 3 quit all within 4 weeks- you know you're shit. I don't regret saying them nor trying out the new place. The people were nice, the office was swank and the ambience great.

Now I still have a new boss in my workplace, same work (but more) and a new boss. She's ok, except that she doesn't step up to be the Asst Mktg Mgr appointment when she needs to. Sometimes I wonder if she's the boss or I am. I may be more senior but I honestly think that when it calls for you to pull your position especially when it comes to approval or talking to management- wtf do I have to do your job? If we really just needed another executive, why are u here? Quit the nitty gritty, plan more and step up when u need to. *pfft*

School's over for me. I finished my last paper and I got a A- grade for it, the way I see it if I didn't score between an A-B, I really might as well quit my full-time job since it was a Marketing Communications module.

WIth school out and a mounting workload with multiple projects on hand and more to come, my life just revolves around work. I'm damn tired and stressed. Thinking of picking up something new... everyone tells me I should really take up driving. So that's first on my list.

Went to Malacca for a short 3 day trip with best pals Els and Nev. Had chicken rice balls, finally bought myself a Congak board and came home with a sunburn and a Chuck addiction. (Chuck on PSP-TV was our bedtime entertainment every night). Those two lucky didn't kill themselves on the trip and Els admitted she njoys irritating Nev and I. I'm sure Nev enjoys irritating Els too not that he'd voice that out. Woe is me.

Loved SATC the movie and even more so about Gossip Girls.  Am in love with Lonelyboy and S. IRL and on-screen. Chuck is great too. Can't wait for Season 2 of both serials.

Mom and Dad got divorced 2 months ago but M is contesting the divorce. More money, more property. Am honestly very sick of her bullshit. So much so that aside from Dad and Euge, I don't even want to talk about it. At all. But it cracks me up with each court session when my D tells me how the Judge questions M and the stupid illogical answers she gives. She honestly thinks she is very intelligent and she has every right to EVERYTHING she asks for when everything about her is illogical and just downright stupid. And I live with this woman. Just too depressing, tiring and irritated. 

Sometimes I get to thinking that some people don't realise the blessings they have and it makes me pissed. They have the money to buy anything they want, loving family and relatives relations, people that love them and shower them with genuine emotions, vacations, yet they take it all for granted. I'd be thankful if just for a home-cooked meal- you just haven't got a clue. I know some of my closest friends think I ask stupid inane questions when I say: so what did you have for dinner yesterday? But just hearing the listed dishes makes me envy, you know? I have a job I love and it isn't like I'm lacking on a lot of things but it's the simple things and the genuine emotions they are showered with that I wish people could be more thankful for, that's all I'm saying. 

Birthday's round the corner but am completely not in the mood for anything. No plans, too tired and unbothered to organize anything, I just want to sleep in on my birthday- now THAT is a great plan. Best bud M is going to LA for her bdae, now that's a wonderful bdae vacation to have. *grin* Hope she has fun.

I straightened out my crazy twisted curls and my hair is straightened with a long straight fringe. Everyone who's seen me thinks its a fabulous hair makeover from wild to little nice girl. Wacked first comments are: Dora the Explorer, looks just like a naughty kid!, Edna Mode with longer hair, so kuai!

I just have to say this but Mariah Carey's song Touch My Body just makes me laugh. Very hard. It sounds so damn stupidly lame and what bloody crazy person would sing a song like that?


Just some instances in the last few months of my self-diagnosis on why I am developing a low tolerance to bullshit.

I will be getting my pc replacement tomorrow, and most likely it will be the pink Sony Vaio notebook. This is where I confess my bimbo self takes over when it comes to my tech toys, 'sadly' as in this case. 

And I will be moving onto greener pastures. Starting next week, I will be taking up the position of Asst Mktg Mgr, Global Marcomms in another cosmetics/beauty co. which is pretty darn exciting but it also terrifies me at the same time. 

So psyched but sometimes I just think I'm stark raving mad: stepping up and doing global markets instead of just domestic. What with my two years of experience, there'll be tonnes to learn and while I've had a junior exec under me the last 6 mths, being a manager is in a totally different ballgame altogether. 

Yet my heart is racing at all the possibilities. 

Maybe my motto in life is the same as EA Games. 

Challenge everything.

This week will be my last week of work with L'Occitane.

What an odd feeling.

Looking back, it's amazing how long I've managed to stay considering my first 6 months was pure hell with a OCD, workaholic boss and close to zero knowledge on marketing, PR and advertising in an fmcg retail environment. 

Since then, learning the ropes and how to manage the boss, my ridiculous head office, 6 retail shops, as well as the expansion of my office has been nothing short of an amazing journey. 

Hell, it's been good 2 years and I know I'm gonna miss this place.
